title: random failures to move files or folders from LOCAL FOLDERS to Main emails.
creator: steve.fritts
content: I'm on latest T-bird 140.7.0-ESR 64-bit. I have random failures when trying to move individual files or folders from LOCAL FOLDERS back to MAIN emails. Moves some, sometimes, then won't move, or will move some but not all, and often corrupts the files back into Main folder. I only use one email under T-Bird. This has happened for years, but I have been judicious about moving files and lived with it. But it's still a problem that I would have thought something like this would have been fixed long ago? .The formatting of LOCAL FOLDERS & FILES in LOCAL FOLDERS seems different & convoluted vs. a straightforward formatting in MAIN where I can easily move withing Microsoft file management. But trying to reconfigure and COPY or MOVE Files or Folders from LOCAL is very problematic.

title: Yahoo IMAP shows both “Draft” and “Drafts” in Thunderbird and can’t remove one
creator: Tibi
content:
Hi, I’m using Thunderbird with a Yahoo Mail account and I’m seeing two Draft folders in the left pane:

Drafts Draft

Their IMAP locations are different: imap://…/Drafts imap://…/Draft

Thunderbird only saves drafts into the Drafts folder (plural). The Draft folder stays empty, but it always shows up.

What I tried so far: • Account settings → Subscribe Unchecked “Draft” there, but it doesn’t save. After reopening Subscribe, it’s checked again and the folder is still visible. • Restarted Thunderbird multiple times. • Server Settings → disabled “Show only subscribed folders”. • Checked folder Properties, but there are no options to hide it or control visibility, so it looks hard locked by Yahoo.

Conclusion so far: Yahoo seems to force both system folders via IMAP and ignores unsubscribe, so Thunderbird can’t hide or remove “Draft”.

Is there any supported way in Thunderbird to permanently hide or ignore the extra Draft folder for Yahoo accounts, or is this a known Yahoo IMAP limitation?

Thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird failed with outgoing server error message
creator: jjanderson52000
content:
My thunderbird email is broken and I cannot interpret the error message. I found a similar problem at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1281109, but I have not been able to follow the solution.

The error message is:

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) promail.ptd.net failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

When I access my email at ptd.net, using firefox, I can make a full connect. But I cannot connect to email using Thunderbird, which is my preferred email tool.

My hope is to have a dialog in this thread with someone who can walk me through the steps to get thunderbird working. Can someone help?

Jim A

title: Thunderbird not trying to connect to mail server
creator: john1022
content:
Good day,

On one of several computers we use to access email when we try to 'Get Messages' Thunderbird doesn't even attempt to connect to the mail server on two of the accounts set up. All four other computers access the servers just fine. In trying to resolve the issue on the recalcitrant computer I created a new email account with the host and added it to Thunderbird using the 'Add Account' wizard, and changed IMAP to POP3. Once the account was created it logged in and received the 'settings' email from the host, and I was able to send an email to another account. I could see the activity reports for the new account in the status bar. However no reports on the status bar for the original two accounts. I've triple checked port settings etc and up until a few days ago Thunderbird worked just fine on this machine. No changes have been made to the original settings. Prior to adding the new account, when asking to get messages the only report on the status bar was 'Done' without any information reported about contacting, downloading etc. The Done message showed up immediately upon clicking the Get Messages button.

Adding the new account and it working properly tells me my settings are correct and the install of Thunderbird is working. Thank you in advance for your suggestions.

John
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:Windows 10 Home
